citation.article-title: Four new species of Chryseobacterium from the rhizosphere of coastal sand dune plants, Chryseobacterium elymi sp. nov., Chryseobacterium hagamense sp. nov., Chryseobacterium lathyri sp. nov. and Chryseobacterium rhizosphaerae sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium hagamense sp. nov.
(ha.ga.men'se. N.L. neut. adj. hagamense of Hagam, geographic location where the type strain was isolated).
Good growth is observed on TSA, nutrient agar and R2A agar, but there is no growth on MacConkey agar.
Colonies are yellowish, circular and shiny.
The optimal temperature for growth is 30–37 °C.
Growth occurs at 10–37 °C, but not at 5 °C or 42 °C.
The pH range for growth is pH 5–10, and that for optimal growth is pH 7.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–2% (w/v) NaCl within 14 days.
The fatty acid composition is given in Table 2.
The DNA G+C content is 36.9 mol%.
Acid is produced from D-fructose (weakly), glycerol, maltose, D-mannitol and trehalose, but not from L-arabinose, lactose and D-xylose.

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, Tweens 40 and 80, i-erythritol, D-fructose, L-fucose (weakly), D-galactose, gentiobiose, α-D-glucose, D-melibiose, methyl β-D-glucoside, D-psicose, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid (weakly), citric acid, formic acid, D-galacturonic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, DL-lactic acid (weakly), succinic acid, L-alaninamide, L-alanine, hydroxy-L-proline, L-leucine, L-phenylalanine, L-proline, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine, thymidine, N-acetyl-D-galactosamine (weakly), L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, myo-inositol (weakly), α-D-lactose, lactulose (weakly), maltose, D-mannose, sucrose, D-trehalose, turanose, xylitol, methyl pyruvate, monomethyl succinate, D-gluconic acid, D-glucosaminic acid (weakly), D-glucuronic acid (weakly), hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid (weakly), γ-hydroxybutyric acid (weakly), malonic acid (weakly), propionic acid, quinic acid (weakly), D-saccharic acid (weakly), sebacic acid (weakly), succinamic acid, L-alanyl glycine, L-asparagine, L-aspartic acid, L-glutamic acid, glycyl L-aspartic acid, glycyl L-glutamic acid, L-serine, L-threonine, 2,3-butanediol (weakly), α-glucose-1-phosphate and D-glucose-6-phosphate.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon sources: D-galactonic acid lactone, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, bromosuccinic acid, glucuronamide, D-alanine, L-histidine, L-ornithine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, adonitol, D-arabitol, mannitol, L-pyroglutamic acid, D-serine, DL-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, 2-aminoethanol, glycerol and DL-α-glycerol phosphate.
Other properties are given in Table 1.
Results from API ZYM tests are given in Supplementary Table S1.
The type strain is RHA2-9T (=KCTC 22545T=NBRC 105253T), which was isolated from the rhizosphere of wild pea (Lathyrus japonica) growing in a coastal sand dune area.
